e4: Maintaining ethical practices builds long-term credibility and trust. While a short-term market dip is possible due to investor misinterpretations, the long-term benefits of transparency and honest reporting outweigh the risks.  Adopting the new policy aligns the company with higher ethical standards, attracting investors who value integrity.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy, providing a fair and unbiased representation of the company's financial performance.  It avoids misleading information, even if unintentionally.  It also considers the potential impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors, and seeks to level the playing field, preventing any group from gaining an unfair advantage due to opaque reporting practices.
e6: I would ask about their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, mitigating potential negative market reactions. I'd also inquire about a timeline for implementation and any anticipated challenges in transitioning to the new reporting system.  Finally, I'd want to understand how they'll monitor and assess the impact of the new policy on investor perception and trading activity.
